snippet: The shares were priced at $30.50 each, a premium to the $28.72 the Treasury needs to break even. American International Group has agreed to buy $3 billion of the offering.
abstract: Treasury Department announces that it expects to raise $5 billion from a sale of shares in the American International Group, cutting the government’s stake in the company to 55 percent.
lead_paragraph: The shares were priced at $30.50 each, a premium to the $28.72 the Treasury needs to break even. American International Group has agreed to buy $3 billion of the offering.

headline.seo: Treasury to Cut Stake in A.I.G. in Share Sale
headline.main: Treasury to Cut Stake in A.I.G. to 55% in $5 Billion Share Sale
headline.print_headline: Treasury to Cut Stake in A.I.G. To 55% in $5 Billion Share Sale
